707797f-a.text:
345 to 361 Second Ave., west side, north from East 20th to 21st Streets, showing a row of 3-story houses erected about 1867. No. 345, the left corner structure houses the Anawanda Democratic Club. The two buildings at the far corner, Nos. 359 and 361 were sold by the Brener Estate (original owners) according to the New York Times, October 13, 1937 and in conjunction with No. 248 East 21st Street will be demolished
for a new 14-story apartment house.
September 15, 1937.
George D. Chinn.
NEG ~ 5E4.
UPDATED INFO 2015: The two buildings nos 359 & 361 at the SW corner of 21st were razed, however the 14-story building was never built. Instead single story building was built in its place, with a printer store at 359 and a restaurant at 361 (Duke's Restaurant existed from the 1950s through early 1970s). A second story was added around 2000 and the building now houses is a clinic.

711547f-a.text:
East 20th Street, north side, between Second and Third Avenues, showing a play yard to the east of P.S. No. 50.  1939

Gift of Committee on Housing Charity Organization Society
Credit Line Imperative

711545f-a.text:
Old stables, 237-243 East 20th Street, north side, just west of Second Avenue.

October 12, 1927.
P.L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS
